Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Scott Whitmore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Arson of Property Other Than Building [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No firearms

Def addresses the court
Court is being heard on sentencing
Court imposes: 
Counts 2, 6, 7, 9, 11, 13, 16, and 20: 1 year initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision- on each count. Each count consecutive to each other. Count 2 consecutive to Ct 3 in 14CF188
Ct 23:1 year initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Consective to Ct 20
Ct 24: 1 year initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Consecutive to Ct 23
Def eligible for CIP and SAP.
Pay costs and fees.
Pay restitution- $27,038. 39- joint and several. Victims to be paid first. May take up to 25% of prison monies.
No contact with the victims or their residence
No contact with co-defendants H.W and D. W
Absolute sobriety. May take prescriptions if prescribed, only as prescribed, and all prescriptions must be approved by agent.
Take part in any treatment deemed appropriate by agent
Def remains in custody for transport
